isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 5000i and 9000i - BATTERY, CHARGING AND CRANKING SYSTEMS - DESCRIPTION - CRANKING MOTOR CIRCUITS

svcsubproc.title: Cranking Motor
svcsubproc.para: The Delco MT-41 Series cranking motor is used with the standard engine in the 5000 i series truck, and the Delco MT-42 series cranking motor is standard for the 9000 i series vehicles. It provides the rotation of the engine crank via the flywheel needed to start the engine.

svcsubproc.title: Cranking Motor Circuits
svcsubproc.para: The cranking motor circuits provide power to the cranking motor to turn over the crankshaft of the engine. If all other systems are operational, the engine will start.

svcsubproc.title: Cranking Motor Thermal Overcrank Protection
svcsubproc.para: On vehicles with thermal overcrank protection (optional system), excessive cranking will cause cranking motor temperature to reach a pre-set thermal overcrank limit, and the thermal switch will open causing the motor to dis-engage. This protects the starting motor from heat damage. When the crank motor cools, the switch closes permitting the crank motor to operate again.
